    • Method Detail

      • findMedian

        public static double findMedian​(double[] array)
        This method first sorts the array using the sort method found in the java.util.Arrays library. Then, by finding the length of the array, it checks whether this length is odd or even. If it is even, it adds the two numbers in the middle of the array and divides them by two. It sets it equal to the median variable. If it is odd, it sets the middle number of the array equal to the median. Returns the median variable
        Parameters:
        array - it's array that user will create
        Returns:
        median of the array

      • findArithmeticMean

        public static double findArithmeticMean​(double[] array)
        This method calculates the arithmetic mean of the given array. This method iterates through the array to sum all its elements. Then, it divides the total sum by the length of the array to find the arithmetic mean. Finally, it returns the arithmetic mean.
        Parameters:
        array - it's array that user will create
        Returns:
        arithmetic mean of the array

      • findGeometricMean

        public static double findGeometricMean​(double[] array)
        This method calculates the geometric mean of the given array. This method iterates through the array, multiplying all its elements together. Then, it takes the n-th root of the total product (where n is the length of the array) to find the geometric mean. Finally, it returns the geometric mean.
        Parameters:
        array - it's array that user will create
        Returns:
        geometric mean of the array

      • findHarmonicMean

        public static double findHarmonicMean​(double[] array,
                                      int i)
        This method calculates the harmonic mean of the given array. This method uses recursion to calculate the harmonic mean. It checks if i is zero, and if so, returns the inverse of the first element of the array. Otherwise, it adds the inverse of the current element to the result of a recursive call with i decremented by one.
        Parameters:
        array - it's array that user will create
        i - it represents the size of the array
        Returns:
        returns the harmonic mean of the array. If i is zero, it returns the inverse of the first element of the array.

      • statInfoAboutArray

        public static void statInfoAboutArray​(java.util.Scanner input)
        This method created for organizing sub-methods of statistical information about an array operation. When this method executed terminal will be cleared with clearTheTerminal method. Then ascii art will be printed. After the necessary explanations about the operation are made to the user, the user is asked for the size of the array that will be created. Then, validation check is provided for this array size (Temporarily limited to 20). The user is asked to enter a value into the double array created with this array size, and control is provided for this double value. After the sub-methods are called, the user is shown the results of the mathematical operations he/she wanted to be calculated.
        Parameters:
        input - scanner variable from main to receive user input

      • printMatrix

        public static void printMatrix​(double[][] matrix)
        Prints the elements of the given matrix in a formatted manner. Each element is displayed with two decimal places.
        Parameters:
        matrix - a 2D array representing the matrix to be printed.

      • calculateCofactor

        public static double calculateCofactor​(double[][] matrix,
                                       int row,
                                       int col)
        Calculates the cofactor of a specific element in the given matrix. The cofactor is calculated by multiplying the determinant of the minor matrix with a sign determined by the position of the element.
        Parameters:
        matrix - The original matrix from which the cofactor will be calculated.
        row - The row index of the element for which the cofactor is to be calculated.
        col - The column index of the element for which the cofactor is to be calculated.
        Returns:
        The cofactor value for the specified element in the matrix.

      • calculateInverse

        public static double[][] calculateInverse​(double[][] matrix,
                                          double det)
        Calculates the inverse of a given square matrix using its determinant. The inverse of a matrix exists only if its determinant is non-zero. For a 1x1 matrix, it returns the reciprocal of the element if it's not zero. For larger matrices, it will typically require further computations (which may include finding the cofactor matrix and dividing by the determinant).
        Parameters:
        matrix - The square matrix to be inverted.
        det - The determinant of the matrix, used to determine the existence of the inverse.
        Returns:
        The inverse of the specified matrix, or a zero matrix if the inverse does not exist.

      • matrixOperations

        public static void matrixOperations​(java.util.Scanner input)
        Manages the matrix operations menu and prompts the user for input. This method repeatedly displays a menu for various matrix operations, allowing the user to choose an operation, such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, or finding the determinant. Based on the user's choice, it calls the appropriate methods to perform the operation. The loop continues until the user decides to exit the operations menu.
        Parameters:
        input - The Scanner object used for user input.

      • textEncryptionDescription

        public static void textEncryptionDescription​(java.util.Scanner input)
        This method provides a user-interactive interface for encrypting and decrypting text on a terminal. The user is presented with a title in ASCII and then given several options and asked to encrypt or decrypt based on the user's choice. The Input Scanner type is used to receive input from the user; the parameter is passed through the main programme and is used to receive text input from the user or to select their options. The asciiArt array is constructed from String elements, each line of which is a line of ASCII art. The listOptions method is a menu that prompts the user to select an option. The usrChoice variable receives input from the user and continues until it reaches one of the options "a", "b", or "c". The check is performed after usrChoice has been converted to lowercase and all leading and trailing spaces have been removed. Encryption is performed when the user selects option "a". The scrollText method encrypts each letter by shifting it five units. If the user selects option "b", decryption is performed. This time, the scrollText method is called with a negative shift value of -5, resulting in decryption. When the user selects option "c", a message appears on the screen indicating that the program is about to exit, and the loop is terminated. If the user enters an invalid option, a warning message is displayed. Furthermore, if the user does not select the 'c' option, listOptions() is called again, and the menu is displayed again. Thus, if the user wants to perform another operation, the options are easily accessible.
        Parameters:
        input - scanner variable from main to receive user input

      • checkVerticallyAndHorizontally

        public static boolean checkVerticallyAndHorizontally​(int[][] matrix)
        Checks the tic-tac-toe board matrix for a winning condition both vertically and horizontally. Iterates through the columns and rows of the given matrix to calculate the sum of elements vertically and horizontally. If the sum matches a specific winning condition (12 or 15), returns true. Otherwise, returns false.
        Parameters:
        matrix - it's an integer matrix created for the tic-tac-toe game
        Returns:
        returns boolean value after checking matrix vertically and horizontally

      • checkDiagonally

        public static boolean checkDiagonally​(int[][] matrix)
        Checks the tic-tac-toe board matrix for a winning condition diagonally. Iterates through the diagonals of the given matrix to calculate the sum of elements. If the sum matches a specific winning condition (12 or 15), returns true. Otherwise, returns false.
        Parameters:
        matrix - it's an integer matrix created for the tic-tac-toe game
        Returns:
        returns boolean value after checking matrix diagonally

      • checkForWin

        public static boolean checkForWin​(int[][] matrix)
        If returns true, one of the player won the game.
        Parameters:
        matrix - it's an integer matrix created for the tictactoe game
        Returns:
        returns boolean value after checking matrix vertically and horizontally and diagonally with if condition and methods

      • printMatrix

        public static void printMatrix​(int[][] matrix)
        Prints the tic-tac-toe board matrix to the console. Iterates through the given matrix and prints different symbols based on the cell value: '.' for 0, 'X' for 4, and 'O' for 5.
        Parameters:
        matrix - it's an integer matrix created for the tic-tac-toe game

      • fillTheMatrix

        public static boolean fillTheMatrix​(int[][] matrix,
                                    int position,
                                    int player)
        Fills the tic-tac-toe board matrix at the specified position for a given player. Checks the specified position in the matrix to see if it is empty (0). If empty, fills it with the player's value (4 or 5) and returns true. If the position is not empty, prints an error message and returns false.
        Parameters:
        matrix - it's an integer matrix created for the tic-tac-toe game
        position - it's the position where the user wants to make a move (1-9)
        player - it's the integer variable representing the player who will make the move (4 or 5)
        Returns:
        returns a boolean value indicating whether the move was successful

      • ticTacToe

        public static void ticTacToe​(java.util.Scanner input)
        LOGIC OF OUR TICTACTOE: The player X represents integer 4. And player O represents integer 5. We wanted to mathematically calculate the winning control of the game by filling the 3x3 matrix we created with 0s. If you place the values ​​4 and 5 in an integer 3x3 matrix, in the checks made for tictactoe (which is done by adding the horizontal, vertical or diagonal elements); if a player has won, you will not find any other value than 12 for X (i.e. 4) and 15 for O (i.e. 5). This game was created using this logic. Within the method, after the game is presented with ASCII Art, a 3x3 int matrix is ​​created, which is filled with 0s. Then, the 4 integers representing player X are defined with the variable named currentPlayer. The user is asked to select a position and the valid position check is done in the loop. If the user has chosen a valid position, the winner is checked after each loop with the checkForWin method, and if there is no winner, the currentPlayer changes (if it is 4 it becomes 5, if it is 5 it becomes 4). At each stage the matrix is ​​suppressed and if there is a winner the game ends with the winner being announced on the console.
        Parameters:
        input - scanner variable from main to receive user input

      • welcomeToApp

        public static void welcomeToApp()
        Shows the user the application's welcome message and instructions. This method calls a method using ASCII art. Shows a message explaining which applications the user can use.

      • asciiArt

        public static void asciiArt()
        Prints an ASCII art to the console. The method contains a string array with multiple lines of ASCII art and iterates through the array to print each line to the console.

      • returnMainMenu

        public static boolean returnMainMenu​(java.util.Scanner input)
        Prompts the user to decide whether to return to the main menu or not. Continuously asks the user for input until a valid response ('Y' or 'N') is provided. If the user selects 'Y', the method calls the welcomeToApp() method to return to the main menu and returns true. If the user selects 'N', the method returns false. For any other input, an error message is displayed and the user is prompted again.
        Parameters:
        input - scanner variable from main to receive user input
        Returns:
        boolean value indicating whether the user wants to return to the main menu

      • delay

        public static void delay()
        Pauses the execution of the current thread for a specified duration. This method puts the current thread to sleep for 2000 milliseconds (2 seconds). If the thread is interrupted during sleep, it catches the InterruptedException and prints the stack trace.

      • clearTheTerminal

        public static void clearTheTerminal()
        Clears the terminal screen based on the operating system. This method checks the operating system and uses the appropriate command to clear the terminal screen. For Windows, it uses "cls", and for other operating systems (assumed to be Unix-like), it uses "clear". If an exception occurs during this process, the stack trace is printed.

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
        The main method that serves as the entry point for the application. This method initializes a Scanner object for user input and presents a menu with several application options: - A: Statistical Information About an Array - B: Matrix Operations - C: Text Encryption / Decryption - D: Tic-tac-toe HotSeat - E: Terminate (Quit) Based on the user's selection, the corresponding application is executed, and the user is asked if they want to return to the main menu after each operation. The application runs in a loop until the user chooses to terminate (option E).
        Parameters:
        args - the command line arguments
